page.title: What is a Smart Web App?
page.description: How to boost value in your client applications
page.html:
Naturally a Smart Web App is first and foremost a Web App, with all the intrinsic benefits of running in any browser and working well on any screen size, on any device. 

An Esparter Web App will utilise the most up-to-date software frameworks and libraries suitable for the project requirements.  It will also be built in an iterative and agile way in accordance with the business objectives.

Latest DevOps, automated testing and Continuous Integration methods will be employed in line with project environments. Further, regulatory monitoring, reporting, and compliance requirements are baked in due to the many years of experience in the team. 

The goal of a Smart Web App is to provide, in addition, datasets on App usage and user behaviours that can be analysed, automatically and in real-time if necessary, which inform and give insight to the service product owners and business on how to improve the App in ways that will add value, both for the user and the business.

Many Web Apps, once they have been in production a while, fall victim to ‘product decay’. In many cases this is because they are hard to product manage effectively and stakeholders become fixated with cosmetic improvements and sometimes whimsical ideas based on their own or a small internal group consensus on what direction the service should take.

A Smart Web App de-risks this and allows product managers to make sound decisions based on data and intelligent insight. A Web App is made Smart through a combination of additional instrumentation in the software engineering and enhancing the data architecture to support new data logging in larger volumes. This allows custom, off-the-shelf and AI analytical tools to process the additional data designed to expose crucial user requirements and behaviours that can form the basis for enhancements on the product roadmap.

A Smart Web App is also ‘cloud hostable’, meaning any back-end services, APIs and databases have been suitably re-factored, and the App can sit on top of a modern, highly performant data architecture. 

This allows the scalability and redundancy benefits of cloud -based services, whether it’s the Bank’s private cloud or a public internet facing service.

To get a taste of how Esparter has been evolving towards Smart Web Apps over its first 8 years, please read the Insights or Case Studies below.  Make sure to follow our LinkedIn Page for new updates or contact us
